subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Re: if you use Ghost radar
author: Kae Tee
full_text:
--0-378012662-1284444149=:12508
Content-Type: text/plain; charset=utf-8
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I downloaded the iOvilus, emFX, magCAM etc for iPhone last week. I found it=
 by searching for the Ovilus information from someone in our group asked me=
 if I had ever tried.. I thought OK, an app for the iphone this CAN'T be mo=
re than a joke.Well, I tried it the next morning before I left to pick up o=
ur boys from school and take them to an appointment. Right away it said "Tr=
ain Tracks" and then "Police". Well, we live near train tracks and there is=
 a place that the police sit. So, I thought to myself, I'll just go around =
the other way because lately I was just feeling I was going to get a ticket=
 or an encounter with a police officer (I know call me silly.. Comes from l=
iving on a military base for years where they LOOKED for people to pull ove=
r constantly just to have something to do so now I live in fear! LOL) So I =
am sitting there thinking to myself I'll just take the other way around whe=
n the thing goes off and says "Accident" "Fire Trucks". So I am
 thinking o=
k, I really will go the other way around now. So, I take the long way and I=
 about peed my pants when I see an accident, police and firetrucks. I calle=
d my husband right away and he's like OK.. calm down.. (Because one of the =
cars in the accident looked like my dad's car. I called my dad but he didn'=
t pick up, which is unusual.. so, me being the no patience worry wart, star=
ts to burn up my dad's phone and I am thinking maybe I should have let the =
app continue!! lol.. He was to pick up our boys and then get my mom but I s=
aid no don't worry about it I'll go get them so he was over that way... Tur=
ns out it was't him..) BUT all that made me sort of on edge. SO, DH starts =
playing with it on his phone at work. He said it just spit out all kinds of=
 garble on his phone. He wasn't even asking questions it just kept going an=
d going..=C2=A0So, I tried it a few more times and couldn't make heads or t=
ails of anything on there. The one time our kids heard it and
 started aski=
ng questions too but nothing that made sense in a response but they had fun=
. =C2=A0So, I didn't play with it again for a while. I turned it on today a=
s I was bored looking through my apps and it says my name right off the bat=
 so I turned it off immediately... DH thinks it's just a coinkydinc because=
 how can an iPhone app do that.. We have had our phones next to each other =
and it picks up different words we were thinking it would say the same bein=
g next to each other.. At times it seems to send our "random" words and oth=
er times it's like making my hair stand up on my arms. =C2=A0The emFX we ca=
n't decide if it's really picking up a true EMF reading or not.. =C2=A0Any =
experiences with any of those? (They also drain the battery very fast!)I wi=
ll go look and see if Ghost Radar is available for an iphone app!
Teddy
---=
 On Mon, 9/13/10, Fiona Broome <email@...> wrote:

From: Fiona =
Broome <email@...>
Subject: [EVP-ITC] Re: if you use Ghost rada=
r
To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
Date: Monday, September 13, 2010, 9:22 AM



=












 
=C2=A0



  


    
      
      
      Hi,



Since I don't =
use a droid or even a cellphone (except when I'm on the road), I won't pret=
end that I have a lot of experience with the Ghost Radar App.



However, I=
 did see it during a lunch in Canada last May.  Two (of the four of us) at =
the table wanted a message from a particular person.  The Ghost Radar began=
 saying things, including several words that -- to me -- clearly indicated =
the painting on the wall next to us.  



(When I'm not being a researcher/=
author, I'm an artist, so I'd noticed the painting's subject, medium, artis=
t's name, date, etc.)



The two people hadn't looked closely at the painti=
ng.  However, when they did, they felt that it included exactly the kind of=
 message they were looking for.



What most impressed me were their reacti=
ons.  Both are fairly accustomed to paranormal phenomena and the ways that =
people convince themselves that whatever-it-is is actually a message.



Ho=
wever, this incident seemed to have significance to them, and satisfied the=
m that they'd rec'd the message they were looking for.



It's just anecdot=
al and just one incident, but... well, there it is.  I think the Ghost Rada=
r is worth exploring if you already have a droid or similar tool.  And, for=
 the price... well, hey, why not!



I'll experiment with it more when I ac=
tually own something it'll run on.  For now, other research is a higher pri=
ority.



Cheerfully,

Fiona



--- In EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com, "Timbo" <ti=

> I started a group about Ghost Radar App. If you u=
se it come by and check it out. I want to be able to share experiences usin=
g the new tool.

> thanks

> http://tech.groups.yahoo.com/group/ghost_radar=
_experiences/

> Timothy

>

grp-text">
      
      
      <p>Hi,<br>
<br>
Since I don't use a droid or=
 even a cellphone (except when I'm on the road), I won't pretend that I hav=
e a lot of experience with the Ghost Radar App.<br>
<br>
However, I did see=
 it during a lunch in Canada last May.  Two (of the four of us) at the tabl=
e wanted a message from a particular person.  The Ghost Radar began saying =
things, including several words that -- to me -- clearly indicated the pain=
ting on the wall next to us.  <br>
<br>
(When I'm not being a researcher/au=
thor, I'm an artist, so I'd noticed the painting's subject, medium, artist'=
s name, date, etc.)<br>
<br>
The two people hadn't looked closely at the pa=
inting.  However, when they did, they felt that it included exactly the kin=
d of message they were looking for.<br>
<br>
What most impressed me were th=
eir reactions.  Both are fairly accustomed to paranormal phenomena and the =
ways that people convince themselves that whatever-it-is is actually a mess=
age.<br>
<br>
However, this incident seemed to have significance to them, a=
nd satisfied them that they'd rec'd the message they were looking for.<br>
=
<br>
It's just anecdotal and just one incident, but... well, there it is.  =
I think the Ghost Radar is worth exploring if you already have a droid or s=
imilar tool.  And, for the price... well, hey, why not!<br>
<br>
I'll exper=
iment with it more when I actually own something it'll run on.  For now, ot=
her research is a higher priority.<br>
<br>
Cheerfully,<br>
Fiona<br>
